course.title: Men and Women in Public and Private: the US in the 20th Century
course.meeting_text: M., W., at 12, and a weekly section to be arranged
course.description: This course offers historical perspective on the social relations and relative power of the sexes, tracing changes and continuities over the past century in family lives, work, popular culture and politics. We will look at sexuality, masculinity, and femininity, centering these in US social, cultural and political history in the context of a wider world.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
